author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector M. Ravikumar addressing an all party meeting in Thoothukudi on Saturday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

Fourteen check-posts have been erected across the district to check the movement of vehicles carrying articles banned by the election commission and unaccounted cash.

Speaking to reporters here on Saturday, Mr. Ravikumar said a total of 18 flying squads and similar number of static squads had been deployed in the six Assembly segments in the district and 14 check-posts erected on all important roads to conduct vehicle checks.

Public and the political parties could register poll-related complaints at 0461 – 2341085 or the WhatsApp-enabled 73588 32293.

“We’ve so far received three complaints regarding poll graffiti made on the walls, distribution of freebies etc and we are verifying the genuineness of these complaints. We will take appropriate action if they are found to be true,” the Collector observed.

Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis said over 3,100 police personnel would be involved in poll-related security arrangements and had decided to deploy Central forces in the hypersensitive booths.

The Collector also visited Government Polytechnic, the counting centre for the votes to be polled in the Assembly election and chaired an all-party meeting.

title: 14 check-posts erected in Thoothukudi district
